output.name: target1
output.token: A <space> ' J O L L Y ' <space> A R T <space> C R I T I C

output.name: target1
output.text: There is a healthy bank holiday atmosphere about this book which is extremely pleasant.
output.token: T h e r e <space> i s <space> a <space> h e a l t h y <space> b a n k <space> h o l i d a y <space> a t m o s p h e r e <space> a b o u t <space> t h i s <space> b o o k <space> w h i c h <space> i s <space> e x t r e m e l y <space> p l e a s a n t .

output.name: target1
output.text: mr Quilter is entirely free from affectation of any kind.
output.token: m r <space> Q u i l t e r <space> i s <space> e n t i r e l y <space> f r e e <space> f r o m <space> a f f e c t a t i o n <space> o f <space> a n y <space> k i n d .

output.name: target1
output.text: He rollicks through art with the recklessness of the tourist and describes its beauties with the enthusiasm of the auctioneer.
output.token: H e <space> r o l l i c k s <space> t h r o u g h <space> a r t <space> w i t h <space> t h e <space> r e c k l e s s n e s s <space> o f <space> t h e <space> t o u r i s t <space> a n d <space> d e s c r i b e s <space> i t s <space> b e a u t i e s <space> w i t h <space> t h e <space> e n t h u s i a s m <space> o f <space> t h e <space> a u c t i o n e e r .

output.name: target1
output.text: To many, no doubt, he will seem to be somewhat blatant and bumptious, but we prefer to regard him as being simply British.
output.token: T o <space> m a n y , <space> n o <space> d o u b t , <space> h e <space> w i l l <space> s e e m <space> t o <space> b e <space> s o m e w h a t <space> b l a t a n t <space> a n d <space> b u m p t i o u s , <space> b u t <space> w e <space> p r e f e r <space> t o <space> r e g a r d <space> h i m <space> a s <space> b e i n g <space> s i m p l y <space> B r i t i s h .

output.name: target1
output.text: After listening so long to the Don Quixote of art, to listen once to Sancho Panza is both salutary and refreshing.
output.token: A f t e r <space> l i s t e n i n g <space> s o <space> l o n g <space> t o <space> t h e <space> D o n <space> Q u i x o t e <space> o f <space> a r t , <space> t o <space> l i s t e n <space> o n c e <space> t o <space> S a n c h o <space> P a n z a <space> i s <space> b o t h <space> s a l u t a r y <space> a n d <space> r e f r e s h i n g .

output.name: target1
output.text: About artists and their work mr Quilter has, of course, a great deal to say.
output.token: A b o u t <space> a r t i s t s <space> a n d <space> t h e i r <space> w o r k <space> m r <space> Q u i l t e r <space> h a s , <space> o f <space> c o u r s e , <space> a <space> g r e a t <space> d e a l <space> t o <space> s a y .

output.name: target1
output.text: Sculpture he regards as 'Painting's poor relation'; so, with the exception of a jaunty allusion to the 'rough modelling' of Tanagra figurines he hardly refers at all to the plastic arts; but on painters he writes with much vigour and joviality.
output.token: S c u l p t u r e <space> h e <space> r e g a r d s <space> a s <space> ' P a i n t i n g ' s <space> p o o r <space> r e l a t i o n ' ; <space> s o , <space> w i t h <space> t h e <space> e x c e p t i o n <space> o f <space> a <space> j a u n t y <space> a l l u s i o n <space> t o <space> t h e <space> ' r o u g h <space> m o d e l l i n g ' <space> o f <space> T a n a g r a <space> f i g u r i n e s <space> h e <space> h a r d l y <space> r e f e r s <space> a t <space> a l l <space> t o <space> t h e <space> p l a s t i c <space> a r t s ; <space> b u t <space> o n <space> p a i n t e r s <space> h e <space> w r i t e s <space> w i t h <space> m u c h <space> v i g o u r <space> a n d <space> j o v i a l i t y .

output.name: target1
output.text: That there is a difference between colour and colours, that an artist, be he portrait painter or dramatist, always reveals himself in his manner, are ideas that can hardly be said to occur to him; but mr Quilter really does his best and bravely faces every difficulty in modern art, with the exception of mr Whistler.
output.token: T h a t <space> t h e r e <space> i s <space> a <space> d i f f e r e n c e <space> b e t w e e n <space> c o l o u r <space> a n d <space> c o l o u r s , <space> t h a t <space> a n <space> a r t i s t , <space> b e <space> h e <space> p o r t r a i t <space> p a i n t e r <space> o r <space> d r a m a t i s t , <space> a l w a y s <space> r e v e a l s <space> h i m s e l f <space> i n <space> h i s <space> m a n n e r , <space> a r e <space> i d e a s <space> t h a t <space> c a n <space> h a r d l y <space> b e <space> s a i d <space> t o <space> o c c u r <space> t o <space> h i m ; <space> b u t <space> m r <space> Q u i l t e r <space> r e a l l y <space> d o e s <space> h i s <space> b e s t <space> a n d <space> b r a v e l y <space> f a c e s <space> e v e r y <space> d i f f i c u l t y <space> i n <space> m o d e r n <space> a r t , <space> w i t h <space> t h e <space> e x c e p t i o n <space> o f <space> m r <space> W h i s t l e r .

output.name: target1
output.text: Painting, he tells us, is 'of a different quality to mathematics,' and finish in art is 'adding more fact'!
output.token: P a i n t i n g , <space> h e <space> t e l l s <space> u s , <space> i s <space> ' o f <space> a <space> d i f f e r e n t <space> q u a l i t y <space> t o <space> m a t h e m a t i c s , ' <space> a n d <space> f i n i s h <space> i n <space> a r t <space> i s <space> ' a d d i n g <space> m o r e <space> f a c t ' !

output.name: target1
output.text: Portrait painting is a bad pursuit for an emotional artist as it destroys his personality and his sympathy; however, even for the emotional artist there is hope, as a portrait can be converted into a picture 'by adding to the likeness of the sitter some dramatic interest or some picturesque adjunct'!

output.name: target1
output.text: As for etchings, they are of two kinds-British and foreign.
output.token: A s <space> f o r <space> e t c h i n g s , <space> t h e y <space> a r e <space> o f <space> t w o <space> k i n d s - B r i t i s h <space> a n d <space> f o r e i g n .

output.name: target1
output.text: And then the picture he draws of the ideal home, where everything, though ugly, is hallowed by domestic memories, and where beauty appeals not to the heartless eye but the family affections; 'baby's chair there, and the mother's work basket . . . near the fire, and the ornaments Fred brought home from India on the mantel board'!
